summary: An email from January 21, 2020, regarding the transfer and processing of digital evidence from devices seized in the Epstein case. The FBI's CART team provided a hard drive, which needs to be uploaded to Relativity for a privilege review, with a second batch expected. The review is to be conducted by a copied individual, following the same process as previous Epstein search warrant returns.

events.title: Transfer of Epstein Case Digital Evidence
events.description: An email is sent coordinating the upload of materials from an FBI CART-processed hard drive to Relativity for privilege review. The materials are from devices seized in connection with the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The FBI's Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART) processed devices seized in the Epstein case and provided a hard drive of materials.
The materials were to be uploaded to Relativity for a privilege review, to be conducted by an individual copied on the email (M).
A second batch of materials from the FBI was expected to follow for the same upload and review process.
The privilege review was to follow the exact same process previously used for Epstein search warrant returns.
The email indicates ongoing evidence processing and legal review in the Epstein investigation as of January 2020.
